intro: Callitriche trochlearis, commonly known as water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Callitrichaceae. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has thin, ribbon-like leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Callitriche trochlearis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small fish.
